TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1322
TEI.2.document_title: L. R. Kenney to Stephen F. Austin, 05-05-1826

barker_notes.barker_summary: L. R. Kenny to Austin [about May 5, 1826]. Indians.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1322

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*L. R. Kenny to Austin [about May 5, 1826]. Indians.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*[About May 5, 1826.]*/p* *p*Dear Sir*/p*
*p*The *person_mentioned*Bearer */person_mentioned**person_mentioned*Roe*/person_mentioned* has a despatch to the *person_mentioned*Comt, at arms*/person_mentioned* I refer you to it for inform11 A *person_mentioned*Choeto Indian*/person_mentioned* accompanies him—*person_mentioned*Roe */person_mentioned*has been of essential service in interpreting to the *person_mentioned*Alabamas */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Choctaws*/person_mentioned* and explaining my views to them—he has been in my employt sev1 days—and for his services Carrying this Commn etc I have promd him $20—1 have paid him $2—please discharge the Balance—Hoping to meet you in *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches*/location_mentioned* */p* *p**person_mentioned*Lauee Rich Kenny*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*Capt Comg Amer Vols on particular service—*/p*
*p*I have pledged my work to *person_mentioned*Roe */person_mentioned*that there will be no disappt. in this payt.—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Lt. Colonel S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*On the road to Nacogdoches or elsewhere*/location_mentioned*—*/p*
*/div1*
